FeedItems.Title: NuGet Spring 2019 Roadmap
FeedItems.Summary: We published our last NuGet roadmap in June last year. Many of the features announced were major additions to NuGet and we have been hard at work to implement those over the last few months. In this...

FeedItems.Title: Enable repeatable package restores using a lock file
FeedItems.Summary: With PackageReference, NuGet always tries to produce the same closure of package dependencies if the input package reference list has not changed. However, there are a few scenarios where it may not...

FeedItems.Title: Lock down your dependencies using configurable trust policies
FeedItems.Summary: For the past several months we have focused on various features to improve package security and trust. Around a year back, we had announced our plans on various signing functionalities that we have...

FeedItems.Title: Improved package debugging experience with the NuGet.org symbol server
FeedItems.Summary: Starting today, you can publish symbol packages to the NuGet.org symbol server. With NuGet.org as a single service provider for libraries and symbols, package authors and consumers will have a...

FeedItems.Title: Introducing Source Code Link for NuGet packages
FeedItems.Summary: NuGet.org now supports surfacing source code repository link for NuGet packages. This will enable package authors to surface both the project’s website and the source repository using the...

FeedItems.Title: NuGet.org starts repo-signing packages
FeedItems.Summary: In May, we implemented Stage 1 and enabled support for any NuGet.org user to submit signed packages to NuGet.org. Today, we are announcing Stage 2 of our NuGet package signing journey – tamper...

FeedItems.Title: NuGet Summer 2018 Roadmap
FeedItems.Summary: This blog post provides insights into the NuGet team plans for the upcoming quarter (July – Sep 2018). In the March 2018 NuGet Spring 2018 Roadmap, we had outlined Package Signing,...

FeedItems.Title: Introducing signed package submissions to NuGet.org
FeedItems.Summary: In September 2017, we announced our plans to improve the security of the NuGet ecosystem by introducing the ability for package authors to sign packages. Today, we want to announce support for any...

FeedItems.Title: NuGet.org will only support MSA/AAD starting June 1st, 2018
FeedItems.Summary: We had previously announced the deprecation of NuGet.org’s home-grown authentication in favor of Microsoft accounts (MSA) that will allow us to add support for additional security systems such...

FeedItems.Title: Welcoming SymbolSource to the .NET Foundation
FeedItems.Summary: We are excited to welcome SymbolSource.org to the .NET Foundation! SymbolSource has been providing a valuable service to the .NET Community for years with the ability to host Symbols for public NuGet...

# Builds

TODO

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Azure Search] Implement randomized A/B test for new search service" (#7166) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Very simple approach.

1. Randomly return a cookie to the user: `previewSearch = true | false`
    - Get the randomness percentage from JSON content file
1. With this cookie as `true`, use the preview search instead
    - Need a cookie so pagination isn't totally crazy and a single user has a consistent experience
1. Add feature flag to turn this off if things go bad.

This should happen once we have decently acceptable results.

Consider putting a Usabilla button on the treatment page.

Events.RelatedBody:
Download Package and Download Symbols are not consistent with the other links on the page. 
They should be Download package and Download symbols. Suggestion made by @loic-sharma during the Symbols Server bug bash.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Why is everything related to nuget package restore/upgrade so slow" (#5805) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
From feedback item: https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/97395/why-is-everything-related-to-nuget-package-restore.html

We have a solution with 12 projects and attempting to manage nuget packages at the solution level is impossibly slow. It takes minutes everything I change tab for the Nuget tab to refresh (which it seems to do everytime, even if nothing has changed). 

This is something that was supposed to be improved in Nuget 3 but is still a problem that plagues us everyday!

Internal feedback ticket# 482138

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "在 NuGet 套件管理員新增套件來源無法調整順序-New kit source in NuGet Suite Administrator cannot adjust order" (#8315) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
NuGet 套件管理員預設就有兩個可用套件來源：

1. nuget.org 2. Microsoft Visual Studio Offline Packages

當我想新增 Azure Artifacts 的 NuGet feed 到這裡來，預設會新增到最後一個位置。

但是當我想移動套件來源的順序時，就算我調整到最上面 (第一順位) 並按下確定，下次再開啟套件來源的選項設定，會看到自定的套件來源還是出現在最後一個位置，不能依照我所設定的調整到第一順位。

這算是 Bug 嗎？

_This issue has been moved from https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/614163/在-nuget-套件管理員新增套件來源無法調整順序.html VSTS ticketId: 934339_ _These are the original issue comments:_ Jane Wu [MSFT] on 6/19/2019, 07:59 PM (19 days ago):

Translated from Bing:

The NuGet Suite Administrator Preset has two available kit sources:

1. nuget.org 2. Microsoft Visual Studio Offline Packages

When I want to add Azure Artifacts' NuGet feed here, the default will be added to the last location.But when I want to move the order of the kit source, even if I adjust to the top (first order) and press OK, the next time I open the option settings of the kit source, I will see that the custom kit source still appears in the last one. Position, can not be adjusted to the first order according to my settings.

Is this a bug?

Visual Studio Feedback System on 6/19/2019, 08:23 PM (19 days ago):

We have directed your feedback to the appropriate engineering team for further evaluation. The team will review the feedback and notify you about the next steps.

_These are the original issue solutions:_ (no solutions)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Manage NuGet Packages VS UI is refreshing too often." (#6570) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
The Manage NuGet Packages for <Solution|Project> in Visual Studio is refreshing _far too much_. it feels like it's based on too many window-like events.

It would be really nice if the UI only _automatically_ refreshes when:

- The UI is first opened.
- A tab <Browse|Installed|Updates|Consolidate> is selected
- The package source is changed (new item in drop down is selected)
- Include Pre-Release is toggled on or off
- The refresh button is clicked.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/899878/36235793-ad9f4ac6-1246-11e8-93cd-9c60dad23027.png)

Currently, if I happen two switch to a new open file, then return .. the entire refresh kicks off again. If I happen to click F5, a refresh happens again.

It's refreshing under too many non-related events.

So would love it if this could be reviewed.

My System:
- Visual Studio 15.5.5
- Projects: "Old" .NET 462.

Thank you kindly!

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Package Deprecation UI - Open questions" (#8314) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
There are 2 open questions for the PM UI for 16.3/5.3

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/2899#discussion_r297328623

Should the deprecation info be displayed in all source? There's no guarantee of consistency here. 


https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/2899#discussion_r297327833

Should the alternative package be displayed as:

current:
`BaseTestPackage version 1.0.0 (or higher)`

proposed:
`BaseTestPackage >= 1.0.0`

//cc @xavierdecoster @anangaur

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support package deprecation in PMUI" (#8243) at NuGet/Home

Events.RelatedBody:
Please read the following information before posting the issue.

## Before posting the issue...

* If you're having trouble with the NuGet.org Website, please post in [NuGetGallery issues](http://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues)
* If you're having trouble with the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), you are in the right place.

Remove the content above here and fill out details below.

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx):

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):

VS version (if appropriate):

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1.

2.

...

## Other suggested things

### Verbose Logs

Please include verbose logs (NuGet.exe <COMMAND> -verbosity detailed | dotnet.exe <COMMAND> --verbosity diag | etc...)

### Sample Project

Very helpful if you can zip a project and paste into this issue!

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "How to integrate nuget in a application" (#8312) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

Its currently not clear how one can integrate nuget in a custom application. For instance [duality](https://www.duality2d.net/) has its own package manager that uses nuget (currently 2.x) internally. However in this version we are running into issues with netstandard where it does not install any dependencies for netstandard packages causing runtime exceptions. We tried [upgrading](https://github.com/ilexp/NuGet4xTest) to nuget 4.x but this didn't work out as its not clear how to use the API.

Please provide documentation on how to implement nuget in a custom application.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "GeneratePathProperty metadata on package reference does not generate the property" (#8311) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I'm using Visual Studio 15.9.11

My code
```xml

<ItemGroup>
    <PackageReference Include="CrossCutting.Build" Version="[*,9999.0]" GeneratePathProperty="true">
      <PrivateAssets>all</PrivateAssets>
    </PackageReference>
  </ItemGroup>
  <Target Name="Mylog" AfterTargets="CoreCompile">
    <Message Importance="high" Text="PkgCrossCutting_Build: $(PkgCrossCutting_Build)"></Message>
  </Target>



```
Expected output:
PkgCrossCutting_Build: <path to the resolved package>

Actual output
PkgCrossCutting_Build:

The property seems not to be generated at all.
